Comments_List: Ethics within the context of relevant biomedical engineering topics
Great course  on ethics and how it applies to biomedical engineering research.
Ethics and morality discussion in many aspects of biomedical research
How to think more critically about ethics, particularly in biomedical sciences
This course allowed me to develop different views of ethics involved in doing research.

Strength- well prepared and organized
Weakness- evening class and in med school
It covered a broad range of fields, but it would have been great to show most of these topics are shades gray by more student discussion rather than lectures.
Strengths include the instructor in which he was very enthusiastic and made us become into the topics.
Strength: comprehensive covering of various aspects about the ethics in research

yes, you probably have to take it. but if you don't, this is a good way to get introduced to ethics and bio. but it's not the best way to learn about ethics in a formal way if that's what you're looking for
Yes. A necessary course to think about ethics.
Yes it is a great intro to think about ethics in BME
